title: Calories in a Double Cheeseburger
meta_description: Discover calories in double cheeseburger, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard fast-food style: two 1/8 lb beef patties, two slices American cheese, sesame seed bun, ketchup, mustard, pickles, onions; grilled, no fries.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, restaurant, patty size, cheese type, condiments, and cooking method. Check labels or apps for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard double cheeseburger has about 450 kcal, with 25 g protein and high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a double cheeseburger from McDonald's?
faqs.a: About 440 kcal for McDonald's version; varies slightly by location.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a double cheeseburger?
faqs.a: Typically 25 g, mainly from the beef patties.

faqs.q: Is a double cheeseburger high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1100 mg due to cheese, bun, and condiments.

faqs.q: How do calories change with extra cheese?
faqs.a: Adds ~80 kcal per slice; two extras would be +160 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there lower-calorie double cheeseburger options?
faqs.a: Opt for no bun or turkey patties to reduce to ~300 kcal.
